website_summaries.verdict: A good feeder at a great value.
pros: Will work for deer, but also other wildlife
Strap to hold the feeder functions well
Product also comes in a larger size
cons: The lid can be a little temperamental but will work well if handled with care

customer_reviews.title: but works great for chickens
customer_reviews.text: Doubt it would work very well for deer since opening is so narrow, but works great for chickens.
customer_reviews.author: sarah vanderhoff

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Cheap and Effective.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for, mounts securely within seconds. Filling was fast and flawless, lid fit perfectly! The spillage in the picture was intentional to help draw the deer over to the feeder for the first use..
customer_reviews.author: Cyber Mike

customer_reviews.title: good feeder.
customer_reviews.text: Had none of the issues described in some of the reviews. This feeder works as advertised, perfectly. The feed used was corn. After a three week wait I checked it a few days ago and the feeder had been found by unknown critters, and about a third of the corn had dispensed and was eaten. Zero issues; good feeder.
customer_reviews.author: TheSergeantMajor

customer_reviews.title: It attaches fine to the tree with the strap
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this primarily to feed the deer that occasionally come into our yard. It attaches fine to the tree with the strap, but once it is about half way filled with feed/corn, the front of the feeder sags and the top does not go on properly. Living in south Louisiana, we have our share of rain, and with the top not securing properly, we have to dump the contents due to mildew and fill up again. We have wasted a significant amount of feed.
customer_reviews.author: Susan RB

customer_reviews.title: Lid Does Not Fit: Poorly Manufactured Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a carelessly manufactured product and I'm sorry I bought it. The shape of the unit and the lid do not match up due to poor molding. The lid does not fit or stay on even with repeated bending, stretching and pushing. The product is a loss. The squirrels are happy, though, as two are sitting IN the bin even as we speak because there is no lid to keep them out. Blah.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Reinheimer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good design
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good design, and very easy to mount. The deer came running when I hooked it up! You do get a little spillage from gravity, but that's to be expected. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is that the way it's designed, there's a wedge on the back side that, when you strap this to a tree, tilts the feeding trough up and out. But unfortunately it also presses the back side of the lid snugly against the tree which makes it difficult to remove and replace the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Wooden Boy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install although I decided to use bungee cords ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install although I decided to use bungee cords instead of the rope they included because my tree was to large in diameter. I think the deer will love this. Will be wonderful to watch from my living room window
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: The price and product are right!
customer_reviews.text: We have a family of four deer and lots of wild birds on our property and all are enjoying this feed station. Overall I am happy with the product. It attaches to a tree eaily and securely; so no need for a separate stand. Angling it very slightly, when attaching allows for easy access to the cover for refilling. As other reviewers have mentioned, the top cover bends easily so you need to handle it with care.and make sure that it is tightly shut to prevent wind from blowing it off. I also found it best to fill the bottom tray first and then add to the top to prevent excess spilllage on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: PCKaren

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for about $19.00. I have had it in place and full with feed at hunt camp for about 2 months now. This feeder is terrible. The lid doesn't go on / stay on and the deer will not eat from it. The only critter eating from it is the raccoons. Check out the pic! I have had a game camera on this since i installed it. Thousands of pictures taken and only the raccoons are eating the corn and they have easy access because the lid wont secure. Save your money, make your own feeders with PVC. I have relocated this feeder to the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: If you have squirrels they will chew through any plastic, so may need modifications or duct tape
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted for a backyard deer feeder. Five stars for sturdiness and $ value, but took one star off for durability against squirrels. After a couple of weeks the squirrels had chewed big holes in the top trying to get in. At this point I replaced the removable lid with plywood that extended several inches out from the edges of the feeder. This solved my problem, at least for now, and my modified larger plywood top is also keeping the feed drier here in rainy western Washington. Basically, if you have squirrels, you are either going to make some modifications or use a lot of duct tape covering squirrel holes.
customer_reviews.author: blu-ray!!!

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years Outside and Still Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had this up for a couple years now and its still in great condition. I leave it out at our Farm House in the south towns of Western NY where there is a lot of snow...I accidentally forgot to bring it in at the end of last season but it survived the winter and is still in great condition. Its in the forest away from the house so I don't see the deer eating from it, but when I go once a week, all the cracked corn I put in there is gone, so the animals are certainly enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Domino

customer_reviews.title: My Backyard Deer Like It
customer_reviews.text: We live in a densely populated urban subdivision and occasionally have these beautiful animals looking for free handouts, so I decided to make it easier for them. I found this feeder that is secured with a sturdy band that wraps around a tree at any height you want and uses gravity to fill the slot at the bottom for discriminating patrons who are hungry. This unit is not designed of rough handling, but for the money is perfect as a backyard feeder. My clients are beginning to know where to go for a free meal, so if you get one, have your cameras ready.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A

customer_reviews.title: strong unit  :-)
customer_reviews.text: My purpose is to encourage more deer into the back yard - just for viewing beautiful animals. Sometimes they came to eat greens on back corner. I don't think they have found this feeder yet.. :-( I was told to place low, but I had to go up about 4 feet to keep our geese from stealing. Thinking of making track of feed from wooded area they frequent to feeder so they will find it. A city guy now in country learning about nature.
customer_reviews.author: R. Denoncour

customer_reviews.title: lid not tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pond in my yard that attracts ducks. I feed them cracked corn I was using a platform feeder but other birds ate all the corn out of the platform( i was filling the platform several times because other birds got it before ducks. i can fill this and feed stays available for ducks birds seem not to eat from it.. the only issue I have the lid fits poorly won't snap down tight... I fill the bin with corn.. it stays dry and bird free! much better than tray(platform) feeding ducks!
customer_reviews.author: suzan Woodbury

customer_reviews.title: With a little extra care it works.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. I did wrap it in chicken wire to protect it from the squirrel as suggested in reviews. I’m sure it made a difference. It’s also good to drill holes from the shoot where he corn comes out as was also recommended in reviews. The cover doesn’t fit well and it’s flimsy overall, but does the job and survived two months on a tree in January and February.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Deer Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall design of this feeder, however, I gave it 4 stars because the lid doesn't fit well after being in the weather. Also, find a tree that is knobby. The first tree didn't hold the feeder very well as the bark on it was smooth. I moved it away from the road and the tree I am now using has alot of bits of broken branches that stick out about an inch or so, hense knobby. The strap is now very secure and the feeder does not move. Be prepared to find that the squirrels enjoy throwing out the deer corn.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cheap molded plastic. Quality is so bad the lid will not stay in place. Clean dry corn just flows through it and pours on the ground. The single strap attachment is not stable it swings around with the lightest touch and often just slides down the tree. Save your money and just pour the corn straight on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Weak Plastic - Basically Barely Usable
customer_reviews.text: This was cheap, but the lid did not sit properly on the unit after it was loaded with feed - probably due to the flex created by weighting the unit filled. It does the job, but the lid seal issue will allow the entry of moisture and possible rodents. Cheap American product and manufacturing. If you have higher expectations, spend a bit more money on a feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Nola and Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We put this up in late summer, now we are in December and it is holding up well. Some reviews complain about the lid but if you are careful to put it on completely, it stays on just great. The strap is kind of a pain to manage at first but it works well, keeps the feeder at the height you want, no sliding down even when full of feed. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: James Laabs

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to hold our outside dog's food. We put it on a pole with grease around the bottom of the pole to keep the food off the ground and away from ants. Works great. The dog loves being able to munch all day.
customer_reviews.author: DiAnna

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't stay on
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few other reviews about problems with the lid, but ordered one anyway. Sure enough, when mine came in the lid seemed to be bowed causing either one side or the other to pop up when the other side is pushed down. I have been trying to use a heat gun on it while it is taped down in place, but that hasn't worked yet. I may need more heat. Otherwise, I may try drilling some holes on either side and put small carabiners on just to keep it from blowing away. Also, the strap is too short to reach around the tree I wanted use. I will figure something out.
customer_reviews.author: Da Slug

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out or used before production for sale.
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this product except they forgot to add a raised lip around the bottom feeding area. 30% of the feed falls on the ground and is wasted. If the product had a raised lip around the the feeder it would be a perfect product. I used for 2 weeks and had to place it back in the box. Can not return it because time ran out, Not usable. Would not recommend for feeding anything unless they eat off the ground and that is the reason i bought the feeder so they eat from it and not the ground. With just one change on this feeder i would buy 10 or 15 of them. EggMan.
customer_reviews.author: S. curtis

customer_reviews.title: Instant Deer
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these up and within 2 hours had deer eating corn out of them. I have had them now for a week and have seen deer every day. Also turkey come to pick up what is dropped. Now the squirrels are also constantly in the feeder but I don’t mind that too much. Also some various birds... but my back yard has now turned into an animal sanctuary. These are great!!
customer_reviews.author: dam65627

customer_reviews.title: A really good value.
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is perfect for my use. I'm disabled and have to use a motorized wheelchair. I have it in my backyard to feed the wildlife that comes there and it's the perfect size for me to carry enough corn to almost fill it. I may have it mounted a little low but so far not a problem. The corn will last a little over a week before running out. So far the squirrels that come and you can't stop them have not damaged the feeder. I'm really pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cecil1946

customer_reviews.title: After we installed the hinges on back of feeder it is more secure and safe  from the elements.
customer_reviews.text: I do love this deer feeder. After a week or so the bucks and does all rally out and around it. However, the lip of the top does not fit the feeder at all. It arrived with the top in package; not secured on top. It is nearly impossible to get the top to fit securely. We are in the process of trying to modify the top of feeder with a hinge of some kind; as it does hold a lot of deer food; if it gets wet it will just be a mess. My to the makers of the feeder is to make the lid more secure; and with that you have a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Qkdrawny

customer_reviews.title: Great, economical feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these in the last month. I have deer eating out of them daily now. The only issue is that once full of corn the lid is hard to get on. I would also recommend putting a rock on the lid as raccoons knocked my lid off last week. Other than that you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Chad D Nicoletti

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design, it is so tiny and the strap is ridiculous, our animals cannot even fit their mouths into the tray, and there is barely room for one of them at a time, this will never work for our needs, returning this item. I expected more from a reputable company, yes I know it is inexpensive but if you cannot make it at least functional why bother?
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Rose

customer_reviews.title: A classic “you get what you pay for “ scenario
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I payed I honestly have no complaints. The straps are strong and hold the feeder in place well. As others have mentioned, the lid doesn’t always fit great but it is usable with a little more effort. I use two to feed my flock of chickens, ducks and turkeys. If I do not have it leveled correctly they can empty it onto the ground in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy mom

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The lid does not snap in cleanly I drilled many holes in the bottom using my cordless drill. Big enough to let water pass thru but small enough so corn does not pass thru. Squirrels hit on it often, not too many deer. Top for feeder arrived warped. Got it on and added a heany brick to keep it from slipping off. I would nit recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: FD Firefighter 121

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Feeder! Super easy to assemble. The deer used it immediately and the lid stays on tight with high winds and keeps the feed dry. Great price point also. Now they are fighting over it. 13 head using it tonight!
customer_reviews.author: LEM

customer_reviews.title: Rip off!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Strap will never hold it straight no matter how many times you adjust it or how right you make it. A chicken will always want to hop on top then boom! Everything spills and ends up on the ground anyway to get moldy and for the pincher bugs to eat. Worthless and I gave it away. Told them to nail it down if they wanted it. Rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Easy Install, Lasted less than a week.
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels are jerks. We know this, but feed them anyways. This feeder is a good design, easy to use, and relatively inexpensive. The squirrels destroyed it in less than a week. The plastic construction is simply no match for greedy squirrels and their wanton destruction. Also, the lid could use a latch, tiny squirrel hands opened it with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Heaton

customer_reviews.title: 20 dollars wasted !
customer_reviews.text: Squirrels had there way with it at the start. First they pulled the lid off ,i had to use bungee cords to keep it secured. Next they ate a hole in the back and ruined the entire feeder , any corn in trough mildewed because of poor drainage. I only had it two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective and
customer_reviews.text: Easy to attach to tree and remains fixed with nylon strap. The deer seem to love it. The only problem is that squirrels can also eat from it but with effort and they don't seem to persist long. I recomend using gloves to attach to avoid leaving human scent.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Warren

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: The deer come and eat the corn that I throw on the ground in front of this feeder (just a small amount).... but they never touch the feeder itself. I'd be interested if anyone has actually had this work for more than just feeding squirrels....
customer_reviews.author: anon2654

customer_reviews.title: Super feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love the strap attachment, can be easily moved if needed. Great feeder. Top was tight and awkward at first, but after a bit in the sun and a couple of openings and closing, works just fine now. Extremely durable with the critters and the cold and warm weather.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Negative to Report!
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of negative reviews talking about squirrels/coons getting in to the feeder. Well I have 5 of these (all on camera) and haven't had the first issue. For the $$$ you spend on them- it's hard to beat...
customer_reviews.author: Will Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Its cheap, basic and exactly what I was looking for. I use this feeder to put my deer feed in. I use the bigger feeders for corn and this for a sweet feed. I hope the squirrels eat out of the opening and don’t chew a hole in the top.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: 4/5 satisfied for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the money i can not complain. I like it to be honest. Only dislike is the lid because it dont close real nice. Have to mess with it a bit. A windy day blew it off but putting it on was hard. Either way i am satisfied 4/5
customer_reviews.author: jimishmong

customer_reviews.title: Chickens roost on top and knock the food out of feeder.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this with my chickens. As far as functioning as a feeder, it’s fine. The problem is that chickens like to try to roost on to of it, and since it’s not super hard plastic, the feed is jostled out when the chicken lands on it. My feeder was empty every 2-3 days, though it had been full. Lots of wasted feed. I wouldn’t recommend it unless you put something above it to prevent chickens from roosting on top.
customer_reviews.author: KareenMc

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: The lid fits very tight and is hard to snap on. The slots the strap slides through are so slim you can barely get the strap in it. The strap broke after about a month on the tree. I ended up just pouring the corn on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: The Last Starfighter

customer_reviews.title: easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: The squirrels were able to chew holes in the lid and the side of the feeder.....it lasted less than a week. I won't buy this again because it just isn't durable. If you feed deer...there are squirrels around.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Dickson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Ehh. Not so great value
customer_reviews.text: One of the 2 in the set came without the holes for the strap. I had to use my dremel to cut slots for the strap to go into. Put the feeders out and the deer and other wildlife avoid it. Will continue to watch to see how the animals act
customer_reviews.author: mommareadsalot

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This feeder worked fine for about a week, then the tree rats (squirrels) discovered it. Ate a hole about 5" in diameter, still use it but if there's corn in there when it rains it will be largely ruined in short order.
customer_reviews.author: Patton Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Deer Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feeder; great quality, sturdy, wraps around the tree well, and holds a good 20 pounds of food without feeling lose. It is durable and easy to put around the tree. I definitely recommend this deer feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We live in a very heavily wooded community and it's not uncommon to see the occasional deer crossing our property. We installed this feeder on a tree close to our house. Now we can sit quietly on our front porch when the deer come bye every evening for a snack of corn.
customer_reviews.author: Jack in TX

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels chewed a hole in the top on the second day
customer_reviews.text: The top is very hard to get on and off as it is warped. The second day we had it up, squirrels chewed a hole in the top. We have had it up a week now and the top is destroyed. Now it will go in the recycle bin. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Love for my chickens!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my chickens to put in the coop so it would be up higher and out of reach of possible mice and it’s been great!! Just backed it on 2 x 4 and mounted on the wall! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these feeders and keep them out year round. Just like everything else, outside exposed to the elements they begin to crack and dry root. They do last quite a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy feeder for the money
customer_reviews.text: The feeder isn't of the highest quality. I used a heatgun to straighten it out enough to get the top to fit properly and stay on. But for the money it's a good buy for a budget feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G.

customer_reviews.title: Chickens tear out all the food
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if I just have ninjas, but my chickens get into this and scatter ALL the food out looking for something tasty inside and basically waste the food. Great idea tho and if you don’t have ninja chicks
customer_reviews.author: Deserae Manning

customer_reviews.title: A wratchet strap woild have helped.
customer_reviews.text: The unit did hold a whole bag of deer corn. The strap that came with the unit did not hold the unit and the corn. It simply slid down the tree. A wratchet strap would have helped. Additionally when the strap was used around the tree the top of the unit warpped and it was hard to get the top on.
customer_reviews.author: KSxsazs

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: Lid does not go on easy or tight. The strap holes were not big enough, had to use Dremel to enlarge . I would return but not worth the gas and hassle. Moultrie should be ashamed to sell this product
customer_reviews.author: David J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Could be better design.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use for goats. Food gets wet in rain and they managed to empty it all in a pile below feeder. Also a squirrel ate a hole through corner lid and body. Could be better. I imagine deer would eat the spillage when hopper is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feeder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can’t beat it. I use this for chicken feed. Works great and holds a good amount of feed. I didn’t use the straps though, I just drilled it directly into two wood post under the coop. If your going to use this for deer feed on a tree I would recommend doing the same thing. Just be sure to use washers.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Wildlife Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Works prefect for my needs. Holds a 40 pound bag of deer corn. Squirrels sit on the lip of the feed chute, but I don't care, because I bought it for all wildlife, including squirrels. Have had several deer as well. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while ...
customer_reviews.text: It did no stand up to squirrels. They chewed a hole it the top, allowing rain to get in and spoiling the feed. Great idea and design but not squirrelproof.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great cheaper option
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cheaper option to feed the deer in our backyard. Not to mention you don’t have to buy batteries for it or worry about it messing up like others
customer_reviews.author: Staci Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: After reading a few reviews, I drilled several small holes in the bottom tray. It rained a whole lot and the rain just drained out through the holes. The deer really took to it the first time they went to it. My problem is that the squirrels sit on the tray and rake the corn out for the other squirrels to eat. When the deer come close, the squirrels leave. It held about 40 pounds of corn. I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wouldn’t recommend for chickens
customer_reviews.text: The product itself didn’t have any issues. The strap was simple and quite secure. I was hoping to use it for my chickens but spilled about 1/3 or more of feed. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: mutteringmomma

customer_reviews.title: Lid was bent and food falls out a lot
customer_reviews.text: Lid came bent and wont stay on it. Also the food keeps falling out. Otherwise it's nice and large! Fits a lot of feed in it. Easy to attach to something.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than Wmart !
customer_reviews.text: Deer suck it dry....squirrels, coons n turkeys clean up the spillage....bears havent found it yet soooo I dont know if it will hold up to them....lid snaps on securely in my experience....should last a good while if the critters dont shred it...
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Paw Chef

customer_reviews.title: Fat Happy Deer!
customer_reviews.text: I’m feeding deer.. They seem to like it I’m putting 25 lbs in every other day! It works great .. I did put a little screw on the edge of the lid .. I think the deer was knocking it off.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used for a Season. They change shape with exposure to weather and squirrels chew holes in them soon. Then water gets in and quickly molders the feed and protein turning into a conjealed mess.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Sampson

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: For the relatively cheap price, it works, the deer eat from it. Strap it to the tree empty with the cover on, then fill it, and the cover will fit. Well, mostly fit. Also I've had (a bear? Giant mutant squirrels? The deer?) knock the top off and chew a hole sorta... but was pleasantly surprised it still functions just fine. Summary... pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Regina M Reinsvold

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I received my new hang-on feeder yesterday was amazed at the simplicity, functionality, and quality for price paid. I would recommend this for anyone who enjoys feeding the wildlife around your home and in your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Raccoons eat right through it
customer_reviews.text: The strap is sturdy and really keeps the feeder in place, but the plastic is no match for the raccoons. I wish this was a metal feeder, but for $20, I can't complain. Maybe I should have glued nails to the lid or wrapped it in barbed wire.
customer_reviews.author: JVelvet

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder
customer_reviews.text: The only negatives are the lid can come off and the corn gets wet and the trough where they eat from also holds water if it’s blowing rain or snow but overall it’s a great feeder
customer_reviews.author: Susie from Missouri

customer_reviews.title: Ya get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Had this only 2 weeks and the squirrels have already chewed thru the top. The gravity feed feature puts more on the ground then in the hopper. I am using whole corn kernels. definitely can't handle the abuse from deer, turkey and squirrel.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. When I first pour the corn in ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. When I first pour the corn in it falls all over the ground. Then trying to get the cover back on is a pain in the butt....I'll be sitting there for 10 minutes while getting attacked by mosquitos fighting with it because it has to be just right to actually close when it's filled.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Lid sucks
customer_reviews.text: Lid is hard to get back on and stay on. Food ends up getting wet in the wet weather especially when the lid pops off randomly. I have used this for rabbits not deer so it would not be my bunnies taking the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the deers! Easy to hang, holds a lot. Top is a little flimsy and doesn't have a tight fit. Squirrels keep knocking it off. Other than that, good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Really nice for animal viewing!
customer_reviews.text: This works well! But make sure you put it in a convenient place for frequent filling once the deer and other animals start using it, they constantly eat Lol !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Found it cheaper at amazon than my local stores! Father in law wants to feed the deer at his lake house! Nice size not too large!
customer_reviews.author: victoria roy

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: You need a higher lip on front of feeder. The squirrels threw 40 lbs on the ground in one day. lid is a little hard to get on and off
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacture..top curves and does not seal.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic top came with a huge curve in it. The heavy plastic handle causes the rest of the top to pull in while curing leaving it curved upwards. It does not snap on or stay on in a medium wind. The feeder then fills with water.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: just what i wanted....
customer_reviews.text: This item was better than expected....much larger...and the price is just right...My husband is a hunter, and he will love this, from santa of course...:) ty
customer_reviews.author: Carol DeMato

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Great little feeder. I like the simplicity and ease of getting it up on the tree. Better than trying to build a feeder on my own. Using it to get the deer closer for viewing. Haven't seen any deer eat from it yet. Hope they soon figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: SabrinaCarol

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Deer have been wearing it out. Strap keeps it stable on the tree. Only criticism is there should be more drain holes. Rain will collect in bottom of feeder. Put in some additional drain holes with the cordless drill. No problems since.
customer_reviews.author: ramSS/T

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels like it more !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for backyard deer for the winter however the squirrels monopolize it...And once the thing is empty, they scratch and chew the thing apart... Top is also a little flimsy, loose seal..I had to use a bungie cord to keep the top on.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough!
customer_reviews.text: The feeder is very flimsy and could be more stable as the weight of the fill is after all heavy. As others have stated, the lid is almost impossible to get on after filling.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: it works ok
customer_reviews.text: The lower volume makes this a bit annoying for keeping filled. The strap is strong enough for most feasting critters. Diffidently not for areas with bears. The plastic just won't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: The Goshawk

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This feeder was easy to install and does the job. It’s a little thinner plastic than I thought it would be but so far that is not an issue. I am using it for loose minerals for my cows.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Hight

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this feeder unless you want to waste food
customer_reviews.text: It's very sturdy easy to install but as soon as you put chicken feed in it, it slides right out and onto the ground. I've been around chickens for a very long time and this is the worst feeder I've ever had I can't stand it
customer_reviews.author: R. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Good deer feeder at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any problems with this deer feeder so far. Great price, relatively durable plastic for the money, lid seems to snap on nice and snug, and the strap held the feeder to the tree nicely. Filled it about 1/3 with deer corn. Now hopefully the deer will come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and the weight of the feed distorts it when mounted on a tree with the strap, which makes the lid hard to fit. But for the price it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Roberts

customer_reviews.title: About 30% of the food ends up on the ground.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cheap feeder. I got it for chickens when I go out of town. The problem is about 30% of the food ends up on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: robojon828

customer_reviews.title: Good feeder
customer_reviews.text: Works good. I would have given 5 stars but there is a plug at the top( not sure why) and the squirrels kept pulling it out until it was eventually lost. Now water gets in at the top
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels eat the container
customer_reviews.text: good shape holds plenty of food , deer like it. squirrels eat the container even if there is no food in it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary U.

customer_reviews.title: Lid wouldn’t fit back on
customer_reviews.text: I pulled it straight out of the box in the woods. You get what you pay for. It holds corn and the strap system is good, but the lid was not properly molded as I was unable to get it back on after I filled the feeder up. I will probably buy another one just because of price. I don’t have to worry about a Bear destroying it.
customer_reviews.author: Brady Helmkamp

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap. My biggest issue is that the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap. My biggest issue is that the lid does not fit on very well. It was a different shape than the unit. It also should have included a strap to attach it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great value for past two seasons.
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for two seasons now and no issues. Inexpensive, durable, and keeps feed dry. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I have always use drum type feeders in the past bought some of these they are working great first week I got 53 videos on one camera and a lot of the deer were eating right from the feeder will be buying more in the future
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work well but I've had deer empty 50 lb ...
customer_reviews.text: These work well but I've had deer empty 50 lb. of corn in two days. I prefer the battery operated type over these.
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: The top does not stay on so o will knock it's down some. Deer eat right out of this works as expected
customer_reviews.author: eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Best option we found!
customer_reviews.text: These work great and you can't beat the price. Easy to setup and fill. I use them both to feed deer and as mineral feeders for our dairy goats.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherLynn

customer_reviews.title: Top doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The Top does not fit. Looks like a tiny chunk out of the feeder. We have to duck tape it and it may work.
customer_reviews.author: murmur

customer_reviews.title: Hoping the deer will leave my bird feeder alone now.
customer_reviews.text: Hoping this will lure deer away from my bird feeder since they now have their own food. Easy to hang. Seems nice and sturdy. Holds a good amount.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money
customer_reviews.text: Cannot go wrong for the money. I haven't had any of the kid fit issues that others here have had. Mine fits very tight. Squirrels haven't chewed through any of it either...yet? Agree with most others...drill more holes for water to drain out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lids do not fit onto base
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 because it was such a good price. But all of them - the lids do not stay on. I'm going to have to rig them somehow to keep moisture out.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie C. Weathers

product_meta.title: Moultrie Feed Station | Gravity Feeder | UV-Resistant Plastic | 40 lb. Capacity | Strap Included
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1With no electronics or moving parts to fail, this basic gravity MFG-13104 offers unbeatable value and unmatched ease of use. Simply strap it to a tree-no batteries, programming or assembly necessary. Moultrie feed station deer feeder also offers surprising versatility, dispensing a variety of feed types, from powders to corn to mixtures.
feature_bullets: Strap for Tree or post mounting included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,190 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
